unit_learning_outcomes.description: Conduct cohesive Chinese-English translation within given time
Demonstrate enhanced skills of using dictionaries and other tools in translation
Enhance the ability in independent and reflective learning through assessing and responding to ideas
Understand and apply the AUSIT Code of Ethics
Identify and discuss key translation theories and apply inter-cultural communication skills, including recognising key factors for specific audiences.
Analyze Chinese texts in various contexts

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on translation practice, reflection of their translation practice and going through relevant materials provided in iLearn.

assessments.description: Students will do a test in class by the end of the semester.
Students are expected to present on their translation strategies adopted for their translation
Students are expected to prepare for and participate in class discussions actively.
Students will complete an online test.
Students are expected to present on their translation strategies adopted for their translation. Students will complete this task online via synchronous and/or asynchronous activities.
Students are expected to prepare for, and participate actively in discussions. Students will complete participation tasks online via synchronous and/or asynchronous activities.
Students are expected to on translation practice. A reflective journal need to be submitted.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit advances engagement with key translation theories and skills and encourages their use in Chinese-English translation practice. Students with both Chinese and English language proficiency will enhance their skills of analysing and comprehending Chinese texts in various contexts as well as delivering equivalent messages in idiomatic English. Students will also gain knowledge of specific professional domains and be able to identify and solve problems when translating from Chinese into English.  Students will develop language and cultural competence as well as analytical and problem-solving capabilities in translation.
data.title: Chinese-English Translation II

description: This unit advances engagement with key translation theories and skills and encourages their use in Chinese-English translation practice. Students with both Chinese and English language proficiency will enhance their skills of analysing and comprehending Chinese texts in various contexts as well as delivering equivalent messages in idiomatic English. Students will also gain knowledge of specific professional domains and be able to identify and solve problems when translating from Chinese into English.  Students will develop language and cultural competence as well as analytical and problem-solving capabilities in translation.
title: Chinese-English Translation II
